page.title: 11The Brambles Play Area
page.content: The Brambles Play area is adjacent to Newlands Junior School so we visited Mr Morris the Headteacher there.He told us how the play area originated. It began as a spare playing field for Garibaldi Secondary School but the school never needed to use it so Newlands School used it as an extra football pitch. In the evenings and at weekends it was used by local teenagers who rode around it on their motor bikes. Mr.Morris thought it was rather a waste of a good field and could be used by the community as a play area if the Council were prepared to spend some money on it. A meeting was called of the people living on the Garibaldi estate as to how they could improve both the appearance of and facilities on the estate as there had been problems with vandalism and litter. At the meeting it was decided
